about.name: Amsterdam
about.info_text: Amsterdam, the capital of the Netherlands, is a city known for its picturesque canals, historic architecture, and vibrant culture. With a rich maritime history, Amsterdam is a city of art, innovation, and free spirit. Visitors can explore the iconic canal ring, visit world-class museums like the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum, and enjoy the charming neighborhoods. Amsterdam is a city that offers a blend of history, modernity, and creativity.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 871,000
Province: North Holland
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Dutch, English
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Amsterdam experiences a temperate maritime climate with mild summers and cool winters. The city is known for its changeable weather, so it's a good idea to be prepared for various conditions.

attractions_card.title: Anne Frank House
attractions_card.description: The Anne Frank House is a historic site where Anne Frank and her family hid from the Nazis during World War II. It now serves as a museum and educational center.

attractions_card.title: Rijksmuseum
attractions_card.description: The Rijksmuseum is the national museum of the Netherlands, housing an extensive collection of Dutch Golden Age paintings and art from various periods.

attractions_card.title: Van Gogh Museum
attractions_card.description: The Van Gogh Museum is dedicated to the life and works of the famous Dutch painter Vincent van Gogh, featuring a vast collection of his masterpieces.

attractions_card.title: Canal Cruises
attractions_card.description: Amsterdam's canal cruises offer a unique way to explore the city, with various options including guided tours and dinner cruises.

attractions_card.title: Vondelpark
attractions_card.description: Vondelpark is a beautiful urban park in the heart of Amsterdam, perfect for picnics, leisurely strolls, and outdoor activities.

attractions_card.title: Red Light District
attractions_card.description: The Red Light District is a historic and controversial area known for its red-lit windows and vibrant nightlife.

attractions_card.title: Dam Square
attractions_card.description: Dam Square is a bustling city square featuring the Royal Palace, the National Monument, and various shops and cafes.

attractions_card.title: A'dam Lookout
attractions_card.description: A'dam Lookout offers panoramic views of Amsterdam from an observation deck with a thrilling swing called 'Over The Edge.'

food_card.title: Dutch Pancakes
food_card.description: Dutch pancakes, known as pannenkoeken, come in sweet and savory varieties and are a popular choice for locals and visitors.

food_card.title: Herring
food_card.description: Raw herring, typically served with onions and pickles, is a traditional Dutch snack and a must-try for seafood enthusiasts.

food_card.title: Bitterballen
food_card.description: Bitterballen are Dutch meat-based snacks, often served with mustard, and are a common accompaniment to drinks at local pubs.

food_card.title: Stroopwafels
food_card.description: Stroopwafels are thin waffle-like cookies with a caramel-like syrup filling, enjoyed as a sweet treat.

hotels_card.title: Amsterdam Marriott Hotel
hotels_card.description: Amsterdam Marriott Hotel offers comfortable accommodations near Leidseplein, with modern amenities and scenic city views.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Pulitzer
hotels_card.description: Hotel Pulitzer is a charming hotel composed of historic canal houses, providing a unique and elegant stay along the canals.

hotels_card.title: Waldorf Astoria Amsterdam
hotels_card.description: Waldorf Astoria Amsterdam is a luxurious hotel set in a grand canal-side building, offering lavish rooms and fine dining experiences.

hotels_card.title: The College Hotel
hotels_card.description: The College Hotel is a boutique hotel housed in a former school building, featuring stylish rooms and a tranquil garden.

transport_card.title: Amsterdam Airport Schiphol
transport_card.description: Amsterdam Airport Schiphol is the main international airport serving Amsterdam, providing a range of transportation options to the city center.

transport_card.title: Amsterdam Trams
transport_card.description: Amsterdam's tram system is a convenient way to explore the city, with multiple tram lines covering various neighborhoods and attractions.

transport_card.title: Metro
transport_card.description: Amsterdam's metro system connects different parts of the city and is an efficient mode of public transportation.

transport_card.title: Bicycles
transport_card.description: Bicycles are a popular and convenient way to get around Amsterdam, with dedicated bike lanes and rental services available for exploring the city at a leisurely pace.

transport_card.title: Amsterdam Canal Boats
transport_card.description: Canal boats and water taxis provide unique transportation on Amsterdam's canals, allowing you to see the city from a different perspective.

transport_card.title: Amsterdam Central Station
transport_card.description: Amsterdam Central Station is the city's central transportation hub, serving trains, trams, buses, and ferries.
